sentence.idiomatic: I’m really puzzled about why I work so hard but get such a low salary?
So many messed up numbers made me really confused.
You won’t feel confused after you finish reading the book.
Our goal is to get first prize.
His goal in the near future is to pass the HSK exam.
What’s your goal for learning Chinese?
He can speak Chinese fluently.
Can you speak Japanese fluently?
Manager Wang doesn’t speak English very fluently.
I have a wide vocabulary but my grammar is not good.
You should increase your vocabularies.
Is his vocabulary limited?
The time is limited. We need to finish the task as soon as possible.
The vocabularies I can memorize are limited because there are only 3 days left.
He just founded a limited liability company.
I need to improve my ways of study.
As a shop assistant, you should improve your attitude.
Does he want to improve his pronunciation?
Next week I’m going to enroll in a Chinese course. I’m frustrated because I’ve been living in China for six months, yet I still can’t communicate with the local people.
But your Chinese is good enough for daily living.
My goal is to speak Chinese fluently in the next two years. Right now my listening and grammar is okay. However, my vocabulary is limited. Meanwhile, I still need to improve my pronunciation as well.
